intro: Dissochaeta, commonly known as the "false sandwort," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. These plants are typically small herbs with simple, opposite leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. They are often found in moist, calcareous soils in temperate regions. Dissochaeta species are characterized by their branched stems and small, often hairy leaves. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
